1112.content:
One morning Tori was laying on her couch texting her friend Kat. She had a day off school and her mom was out for the day. She was getting more bored by the minute though, which often happened when she wasn't with her friends.

She tried to think of something to do when she saw a magazine lying on the kitchen table. She got up and walked to the table and picked up the magazine. "What's this? It must be something my mom brought from the store." She glanced around before taking it with her back to the couch and began to glance trough the magazine.

Most of it was the usual trash such as recent celebrity break ups and fashion tips. Tori was about to put it down when the next page caught her eye. The title read Fat people sing best!" Tori was interested and began to read the article. It went into detail saying that the best and most popular up and coming singers were really fat. Tori's dream was to become a famous singer but recently was losing inspiration, fearing she wouldn't be any good. "So it says fat girls are better singers huh", Tori wondered. She looked in the mirror. "I've never thought about being fat before, it would be a massive leap, just to improve my career." She sighed. It was getting late. Tori slowly began to drift off into sleep. "I wonder if that article is true", Tori said to herself as she fell asleep.

112.content:
"Do these jeans make my butt look big?"

"I'm not gonna say anything cause either way, I'm gonna get slapped." said the young song writer Andre

"I think your butt looks enormous today," came from the cynical teen Jade

"Well, Jade insulted me, I know I look fine."

And Tori was right. She was the most stunning girl on campus, though most of the guys chased after the NorthRidge girls. She had a body most men would die for, even her face showed how beautiful she was.

But the they heard a bloodcurdling scream from down the hallway. The young awkward boy Robbie and his puppet companion ran towards the group completely out of breath.

"What happened this time Robbie?" asked Beck, obviously having to deal with things like this constantly.

"You haven't heard?" the puppet Rex asked, "The nurse just got a new shipment of needles and flu shots!"

"And that's not even the worst part!" Robbie yelled, "I can't find anything about the company she got the flu shots from".

Everyone got scared at this comment, Robbie was a wizz at finding things online.

"Tori Vega to the nurse's office please," the hallway speakers blared.

"Wait what!?" Tori screamed.

"When was you last flu shot?" Andre asked.

"I don't know like... 4... years... ago. Dang."
112.title: It begins with her end

1122.content:
Even though she really didn't want to, Tori knew that she would have to get the shot one way or another, so she decided that it would just be easier to take the shot now and get it over with.

"Well, guys, wish me luck!" she said to her friends before turning and walking towards the nurse's office. On her way, Tori could have sworn that she heard the conversations of the people around her talking about rusty needles, bad medicine, and horrible diseases.

It's nothing," she told herself calmly. "You're just a little nervous about getting a shot for the first time in a long time. Everything is going to be just fine." Tori continued on, and soon she arrived at the nurse's office. There was a small line of students sitting out front, and Tori assumed that they were all there for the same reason that she was. A few minutes went by, and the nurse opened the office door to let another student out.

"Tori Vega?" she called out the open door. Tori stood up, and the nurse said, "Ah, good, you're here right on time for your shot!" Assuming it was a flu shot, Tori went into the nurse's office without asking a question. Everything went smoothly. She got her shot, put a band-aid on it, and that was that. Nothing more to it.

"Ha!" Tori laughed as she walked out of the nurse's office. "I can't believe that I was actually scared of that little old shot!" As she walked to her next class, Tori began to feel light-headed. Attributing it to the shot, Tori continued towards her next class, but when the feeling got stronger, she knew that something was wrong.

"I don't think that a shot is supposed to make me feel this weird..." she said nervously as her face began to turn paler.
1122.title: Suck it up and take the shot

11223.content:
"Oh, man, this is just too much," Tori finally said. "I've gotta get out of here and get home to relax for a bit."

Tori left the school building and got in her car to drive home. She may have been light-headed, but she could still focus enough to drive home. After all, it was only a five minute drive. Tori buckled up, backed out of the parking lot, and began her way home. A little ways out, Tori's head was beginning to feel just a little bit better, but she could have sworn that her pants were feeling a bit tighter than before.

When she got home, Tori went over to her couch and flopped down. Before she fell asleep, she found a note from her parents on the table.

"I guess that this was supposed to be for after school," she thought to herself. She picked up the note and read it.

Tori, we're going to have to leave you alone at home for a couple of weeks. Trina decided that it would be a good idea to try and hack into Birntey Spears' phone line to try and get closer to Brad Pitt, and now we've got to go and deal with her and her lawyers. We'll do out best to keep in touch. Try your best to stay out of trouble! - Mom + Dad

"Well, at least I'll have some time to myself." Tori thought as she dozed off into a deep slumber.
11223.title: Go home.

114.content:
Once upon a time, a group of unambitious idiots formed a fake ping pong team and used the funds to go to a fancy restaurant. Some weeks back, the scheme was found out but rather than publicly reveal how easily so much money had been stolen, Hollywood Arts had the group join actual sports teams instead.

In Beck and Andre's case, that involved them trying out for football and going by the fact that they'd been tackled down eighty-seven times in the last twelve minutes, they would likely have concussions very soon.

In Tori's case, she'd exploited a loophole and signed on as Hollywood Arts's only cheerleader, cheering on the football tryouts, which perhaps not so coincidentally had led to a massive influx of applicants. After all, everyone was quite eager to see a sexy Latina in a cheerleader outfit.

Well almost.

Jade had tried out to be a cheerleader but was told by the school that she was too fat (actually they'd said she was a day late for tryouts but Jade's brain was not wired quite right). Instead, Jade was on the croquet team but had plans to make the cheer squad open up very soon.

Stealthily, Jade snuck up behind Tori and swapped out her water bottle for one containing a special potion Jade had found online that would Tori balloon up like... well like a balloon.

"Let's see you do your cheer routines when you're so huge." Jade snarked as she sat down. Of course the online instructions had been in Romanian but Jade was pretty sure she'd translated it well enough.

Soon enough a break was held and Jade joined Tori, Beck, and Andre at the bleachers. "I think that went well." Beck said rubbing his head.

"Is that how you remember it?" Tori snarked as she downed her water bottle.

"How's that water Tori?" Jade smiled sadistically.

"It's fine?" Tori shrugged. Jade frowned. Tori's gut should be halfway to San Diego by now.

"Hey since when are you taller than me?" Beck asked Tori, her forehead now an inch above his hair.

"I'm not, I'm on a higher step."

"No you're not." Andre said pointing to their feet, Tori's foot steadily growing larger and larger.

"Oh shit." Jade thought as she realized what was happening and that her Romanian could use some practice.

"EVERYONE BACK!" Beck called. "Give her some room." Already the metal was starting to creak and groan from Tori's weight. At 25 feet tall, Tori stumbled back and fell over, her sheer size causing the bleachers to cave in and bend upwards.

"Ooh this got really fun." Ryder smirked, Tori's fall allowing everyone a perfect view up her skirt as she continued to grow larger and larger finally coming to a stop at 100 feet tall.

Shakily, Tori forced herself upwards, her gigantic hands destroying what was left of the bleachers, and took a few booming steps forward. "Is everyone alright? Did I step on anyone?"

No one answered her for every guy was too busy staring up her skirt, some drooling, some taking pictures, yet all with their hands beneath their waistlines.

"Hey don't do that!" Tori snapped tugging her skirt down in an ineffectual attempt to cover herself before her eyes landed on the one person not pleasuring themselves at the sight of her.

"Jade." Tori glared.

"Babe we're done forever but thank you so much." Beck called to Jade, an impossibly wide smile on his face as he started at Tori's legs.

Tori rolled her eyes and took only two steps to reach the insecure Goth, uncaring that she'd just allowed the football team a perfect view of her bus-sized ass.

Jade looked around frantically trying to decided whether she should submit to the giantess or at least try and make a run for it.

What happens next?
